keyMoments.moment: Reveals his Fairy Vearth plan and intention to destroy Skypiea
keyMoments.significance: Exposes his ultimate goal and the full extent of his tyrannical plans

keyMoments.moment: Defeats Gan Fall with 30 million volt attack

keyMoments.significance: Shows his disdain for manipulation and his ruthlessness

keyMoments.moment: Defeats Zoro by channeling electricity through his swords
keyMoments.significance: Displays tactical intelligence in using opponents' weapons against them

keyMoments.moment: Falls unconscious after Wyper's Seastone and Reject Dial attack
keyMoments.significance: First time Enel is truly defeated in combat, his heart stops

reveals.information: Fairy Vearth is his ultimate destination, a place of infinite vearth where he believes God should reside
Plans to commit genocide against all Skypieans before leaving
Believes people living in the sky is unnatural and maintaining natural order is his divine duty

abilities.name: 30 Million Volt Attack
abilities.description: Powerful electrical attack capable of gravely injuring opponents

abilities.name: Electrical Conduction Through Weapons
abilities.description: Can channel electricity through metal objects like swords to electrocute opponents

relationships.description: Wyper successfully defeats Enel temporarily using Seastone and Reject Dial
Gan Fall challenges Enel but is gravely injured by his 30 million volt attack

keyMoments.moment: Flashback showing young Wyper learning about the Shandia's duty to protect the ancient tablet
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the generational burden and motivation behind Wyper's actions

keyMoments.moment: Uses Seastone weapon to nullify Enel's Devil Fruit powers
keyMoments.significance: First effective counter to Enel's Logia abilities, shows Wyper's tactical preparation
Ultimate sacrifice move that could kill Wyper himself, demonstrates his complete dedication
Achieves what no other character could—temporarily defeating the god of Skypiea

reveals.information: Has Seastone bandaged to his left arm as a secret weapon against Devil Fruit users
Carries the ancestral duty of protecting the ancient stone tablet, a burden passed down for 800 years

abilities.name: Seastone Weapon Technique
abilities.description: Uses Seastone bandaged to his arm to nullify Devil Fruit powers on contact

abilities.name: Reject Dial Attack
abilities.description: Unleashes the Reject Dial, a weapon ten times more powerful than Impact Dial that can kill both user and target

relationships.description: Wyper defeats Enel using Seastone and Reject Dial, stopping his heart

keyMoments.moment: Defends Robin's honor after Enel strikes her down
keyMoments.significance: Shows Zoro's protective nature and chivalry towards women

keyMoments.moment: Successfully slashes through Enel's Logia body
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's skill in landing a hit, but also reveals the futility of physical attacks against Logia users

keyMoments.moment: Defeated when Enel channels electricity through his swords
keyMoments.significance: Shows the vulnerability of using metal weapons against electrical powers

relationships.description: Zoro defends Robin after she is struck down by Enel
Zoro attacks Enel to avenge Robin but is defeated

keyMoments.moment: Attempts to manipulate Enel using psychological tactics
keyMoments.significance: Shows Robin's strategic thinking and unconventional approach to combat

keyMoments.moment: Knocked unconscious by Enel's lightning attack
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the ineffectiveness of manipulation against Enel and triggers Zoro's protective response

relationships.description: Robin attempts to manipulate Enel but is struck down for her efforts

keyMoments.moment: Challenges Enel declaring the world doesn't need a god
keyMoments.significance: Shows Gan Fall's moral courage and opposition to tyranny despite overwhelming odds

keyMoments.moment: Gravely injured by Enel's 30 million volt attack
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Enel's lethal power and adds to the growing list of defeated opponents

relationships.description: Gan Fall opposes Enel's tyranny but is gravely injured in the attempt

keyMoments.moment: Skypiean children discuss Conis, with some calling her and Pagaya evil for helping the Blue Sea Dwellers
keyMoments.significance: Shows the social consequences of defying Enel and the propaganda affecting even children

reveals.information: Has become a controversial figure in Skypiean society for helping the Straw Hats escape

keyMoments.moment: Skypiean children discuss Pagaya, with some calling him and Conis evil for helping the Blue Sea Dwellers
keyMoments.significance: Shows the social consequences of defying Enel

reveals.information: Has become a controversial figure in Skypiean society for helping the Straw Hats escape
